intro: Olearia occidentissima, commonly known as the Western Daisy-bush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like inflorescences composed of white ray florets and yellow disk florets. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has silver-green, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Olearia occidentissima is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
